Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Archbishop Angelo Rosario, Church of God’s Children Church
127 Dreiser Loop, Bronx, New York 10475.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Seabrook.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Archbishop Angelo Rosario, Church og God's Children Church, 127 Dreiser Loop, The Bronx, New York 10475.

Council Member Seabrook moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 11, 2009 be adopted as printed by Council Member de Blasio.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member de Blasio moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 11, 2009 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Betty Y. Chen to the Council for its advice and consent regarding her reappointment to the City Planning Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 192 of the City Charter.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections
Items.MatterName: Betty Y. Chen, City Planning Commission

Items.MatterName: Nancy G. Chaffetz, New York City Civil Service Commission

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor - Submitting the name of Stephen F. Byrns to the Council for its advice and consent regarding his reappointment to the Landmarks Preservation Commission, Pursuant to Sections 31 and 3020 of the City Charter.

Items.MatterName: Stephen F. Byrns, Landmarks Preservation Commission

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 070305 ZSM, a special permit to allow the development of a 37 space accessory parking garage within the cellar 405-427 W. 53rd Street, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, a special permit to allow the development of a 37 space accessory parking garage within the cellar 405-427 W. 53rd St. (C070305ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Garodnick:
Application no. 20095084 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition for La Goulue Restaurant, Inc., to continue to maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 746 Madison Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 4.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk cafe, La Goulue Restaurant, Inc.an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 746 Madison Ave, Manhattan (20095084TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mark-Viverito:
Application no. 20095069 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition for Silver Moon Bakery, Inc. to continue to maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at2740 Broadway, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 8.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe,  Silver Moon Bakery, Inc. an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 2740 Broadway, Manhattan (20095069TCM)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter in relation to changing the compensation of members of the city council.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Changing the compensation of members of the city council.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to amend Article 11 of the New York State Environmental Conservation Law to add Quaker parrots to the list of “protected birds,” which will oblige the City to take all possible steps to humanely relocate Quaker parrots that have nested on city-owned properties that are slated for demolition or removal or where other projects require removal of the birds.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Amend Article 11 of the NYS Environmental Conservation Law to add Quaker parrots to the list of “protected birds".

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to unattended vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Unattended vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to making available to all Parent Associations, Parent Teacher Associations and Community Education Councils the equipment necessary to enable such entities to webcast their meetings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Making available to all Parent Associations, Parent Teacher Associations and Community Education Councils the equipment necessary to enable such entities to webcast their meetings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter in relation to the powers of the fire commissioner.
Items.AgendaNote: Fire and Criminal and Justice Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Powers of the fire commissioner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to collecting and reporting data related to youth aging out of foster care.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Collecting and reporting data related to youth aging out of foster care.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the federal government to recognize legally married same-sex couples in the 2010 census, and to begin counting lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender individuals in other federal surveys.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Federal government to recognize legally married same-sex couples in the 2010 census, and to begin counting lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender individuals in other federal surveys.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the New York city department of education to provide the metropolitan transportation authority with certain student enrollment information.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYC dept of education to provide the metropolitan transportation authority with certain student enrollment information.

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the New York Post for its racist depiction of President Barack Obama in a political cartoon.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Condemning the New York Post for its racist depiction of President Barack Obama in a political cartoon.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City Charter, in relation to requiring the City Record to be published online and available to the public at no charge.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring the City Record to be published online and available to the public at no charge.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the creation of a Street Vendor Advisory Board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Creation of a Street Vendor Advisory Board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing members of the New York City Police Department to remain in service until age sixty-five.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Allowing members of the New York City Police Department to remain in service until age sixty-five.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to responsibilities of notification to tenants by entities commencing action to recover real property in foreclosure actions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Responsibilities of notification to tenants by entities commencing action to recover real property in foreclosure actions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Senate to pass and the President to sign the Credit Cardholders’ Bill of Rights.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Senate to pass and the President to sign the Credit Cardholders’ Bill of Rights.
